result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC 7th Offense. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC 7th Offense was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd Adam Hollfelder was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample (Court waived the DNA surcharge as it was ordered in case # 15CF845).   
Pay $600 fine and all applicable, mandatory costs, fees, assessments & surcharges.   
The Court ordered that all financial obligations and/ or restitution be paid through collection by the  DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  ANy amount remaining due & owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but ONLY AFTER serving 2.5 years of this sentence and the sentence in case # 15CF845
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case # 15CF845, but consecutive to any other time being served

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/ maintain full-time employment or full-timeschool and part-time employment.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm and his voting rights are suspended until his civil rights are restored.

NO drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/ dealers or drug houses). 
No new law violations rising to probable cause.

Cooperate  with any an all rules set forth by the Probation agent.   
Mental health assessment and any follow-up care and/or treatment.   
Take all medications in a manner prescribed by a treating physician.  
Provide DNA sample for the Data Bank.   
Participate in any and all programing DOC thinks is appropriate or recommended by the assessing agency.

supervisions.notes: Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete any follow-up treatment.  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (40 pages) commencing JULY 6, 2015 received and filed.
Per Order signed on 9/23/2015:  severity shall be amended to reflect that the severity of count one is "Felony G".
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copy sent to Dodge Correctional and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. crt
from DOC requesting review of JOC.
Associated with Charge #1
in support of the defendant received and filed.
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement received and filed.

As to Count 2: Pursuant to negotionations and due to operation of law, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.  
As to Count as Amended 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Operating While Intoxicated- 7th Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(a) 346.65(2)(am)6, 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.
Court ordered charge amended to Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration- 7th Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(b), 346.65(2)(am)6, 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.

For reasons stated on the record and upon stipulation of the parties, the Court removed the penalty enhancer section from the Amended Information.

Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On oral motion of the State, the Court ordered the criminal complaint amended to include the OWI conviction in case #15CF845.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties need to determine which of defendants two pending OWI cases will be a 6th and 7th.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution as to all 4 of the defendants' cases.  Defense requests date for change of plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in custody.  Lindsay Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
